_header: A Christian priest was called Carpus
_description: The story of Carpus in the Northern Homily Cycle — in couplets

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
A Crrystyn prest was cald carpusþat so in þis werld lufyd
                    Ihesus…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesus graunt vs þat wetnesof þat trew luf
                    þat ys endelese

BodAsh42.First Lines:
A cristend preste was callid carpusþat luffid so inwardeli
                    ihesus…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…þare to ihesu criste vs spedeAnd to him self vs luffli
                    lede
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
AN holy prest was clept carpusAnd louede so inwardliche
                    Ihesus…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Ihesu to loue him help vs and redeAnd to his blisse alle vs
                    lede. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Die Evangelien-Geschichten der Homiliensammlung des Ms. Vernon.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         57 (1877): 241-316: 278-9.

CULAdd8335.First Lines:
A cristen preste was called CarpusÞat so inwardli lufed
                    ihesus…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:
…Nowe ihesu graunte vs þat swetnesOf þi trewe luf
                    þat es endeles
CULAdd8335.Attributed Title:
de sancto Carpo presbitere orante pro vindicta capienda (f.
                    206)

CULDd11.First Lines:
A cristen prest was cald Carpus& he louid so inwardli
                    ihesus…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…Ihesu to loue him righteli vs redeand to his blisse alle vs
                    lede

CULGg531.First Lines:
A cristen preste was cald carpusþat lufed swa inwardly
                    ihesus…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
…þare to ihesu criste vs spedeAnd tyll hym selfe vs fully
                    lede

BLHar2391.First Lines: A cristen prest was cald karpusþat lufd so inle Indwardly Ihesus…
BLHar2391.Last Lines: …þat so Ihesu crist vs spedeAnd to hym self vs lufly lede
BLHar2391.Note: In second line, “inle” written and crossed through before “Indwardly”; ends “Amen.”
BLHar2391.Attributed Title: In ascencione domini (left margin, f. 191v) with “A tale” written below

BLHar4196.First Lines: A cristen prest þat hight carpusSo inwardly he lufed ihesus…
BLHar4196.Last Lines: …And bring vs to þat blisced hedeþare þe sight of ihesu sall vs fede

MinULZ822.First Lines:
A crystyn preste þat hyght carpusþat lufyd swa inwardly
                    Ihesus…
MinULZ822.Last Lines:
…Ihesu to lufe hym ryght vs spedeand till hym selfe vs lufly
                    lede

HunHM129.First Lines:
A cristyn prest wos callyd carpusAnd he so in wardly louyd
                    ihesus…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…Ihesu to loue ryght hym vs spedeAnd to hym self he vs lonely
                    lede
